meanings.definition: Not appropriate or suitable for a particular purpose or person.
meanings.sent1: The heavy winter coat was unsuited for the hot summer weather.
meanings.sent2: The formal suit was unsuited for the casual beach party.
meanings.sent3: The tiny umbrella was unsuited for the giant elephant.
meanings.sent4: Her loud voice was unsuited for the peaceful library atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The rusty old bike was unsuited for the fast-paced race.

meanings.definition: Not having the necessary qualities or skills for a particular task or role.
meanings.sent1: His short height made him unsuited for the basketball team.
meanings.sent2: The shy student felt unsuited for the class presentation.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat seemed unsuited for the role of a guard dog.
meanings.sent4: Her clumsy fingers were unsuited for delicate embroidery work.
meanings.sent5: The old computer was unsuited for running the latest software.
